alert.note: Alert for Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:19PM EDT until August 10 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL ANNE ARUNDEL AND NORTHEASTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES... At 518 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Crofton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Localized 65 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Bowie, Severn, Annapolis, Crofton, Riviera Beach, Mayo, Naval Academy, Severn River, Gibson Island, Bodkin Point, Sillery Bay, Magothy River, Dobbins Island, Pinehurst, Fort Smallwood State Park, Glen Burnie, Severna Park, Odenton, Laurel and Pasadena. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
